business.headline: Why saving 30% of your income isn't always possible, CA explainsFor those supporting families or beginning their careers, setting aside a significant portion of their income can be particularly challenging, explains CA Abhishek Walia. For those supporting families or beginning their careers, setting aside a significant portion of their income can be particularly challenging, he says.

Will Sensex and Nifty hit record highs in July? Here's all you need to knowWith domestic flows steady and global risks fading, July could be the moment markets break through resistance. But with key events ahead, will momentum hold or falter?

JSW Paints to acquire majority stake in Akzo Nobel IndiaWith this move, JSW Paints will take sole control of Akzo Nobel India, which operates under the Dulux brand, and emerge as the fourth-largest player in the decorative paints segment.

Sensex, Nifty open higher for 4th straight session as global cues aid momentumThe BSE Sensex opened with a gain of over 140 points and was trading 89.06 points higher at 83,844.93 around 9:22 am. The NSE Nifty50 breached the 25,600-mark at the open before paring some gains to trade 25.35 points up at 25,574.35.

Once-dominant online job boards CareerBuilder, Monster go bankruptCreated through the September merger of CareerBuilder and Monster, the Chicago-based company said it agreed to sell its job board operations, its most recognisable business, to JobGet, which has an app for so-called gig workers.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Penalties, missed refunds and what to do nextWhether you're a salaried professional, freelancer, or a business owner, choosing the right ITR (Income Tax Return) form is important. Getting it wrong might mean missed refunds, penalties, or worse, your return being treated as invalid.

Sensex ends 1,000 points higher, Nifty above 25,500; Tata Steel gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,000.36 points to end at 83,755.87, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 304.25 points to close at 25,549.00.

From phones to partners: 8 money lessons to learn before 30Managing money isn't just about making budgets, it's about making better choices, every single day. CA Nitin Kaushik shares eight crucial money lessons that everyone should grasp by the age of 30.

Are your savings at risk? Government may slash PPF, NSC rates next weekSo far this year, interest rates for schemes such as Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana (SSY), Senior Citizens Savings Scheme (SCSS), and Post Office term deposits have remained unchanged. However, this may not continue in the next quarter.

Housing sales drop 20% across top 7 cities in Q2 2025 as prices stay highA sluggish Q2 masked early signs of recovery in India's housing market, with rising prices, cautious buyers, and skewed supply dampening sales—but softening rates and easing tensions may turn the tide.

Hiding income or making wrong claims? Your ITR could attract a 200% penaltyThe recent changes in Income Tax Return (ITR) regulations highlight stricter penalties for incorrect filings, including a potential 200% penalty on false claims.

Roti, kapda, but no makaan? The disappearing dream of affordable housingAffordable housing is vanishing from India's cities, and the crisis runs deeper than shrinking supply. In this deep dive, we explore how rising costs, fading supply, and policy gaps are shutting the door on millions chasing the ownership dream.

entertainment.headline: Pushpa girls Samantha, Sreeleela end rift rumours with warm hug at event. WatchActors Samantha and Sreeleela put speculations about their rift to rest in their latest public appearance together. Reports emerged in 2024 that claimed Sreeleela had replaced Samantha in a special dance number for 'Pushpa 2'.

Jeff Bezos Venice wedding: Kardashians, Leo DiCaprio, Orlando Bloom check inBillionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancee Lauren Sanchez have begun their lavish three-day wedding festivities in Venice. The Kardashian family, Oprah Winfrey, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Bill Gates, among other celebrities, got clicked as they joined the couple for the festivities.

Sitaare Zameen Par box office Day 7: Aamir Khan's film wraps up a solid first week'Sitaare Zameen Par' will now face Kajol's 'Maa' at the box office. The latter could pose a challenge to the smooth run of Aamir Khan's film, given the extensive screen sharing at the box office.

Rashmika Mandanna looks unrecognisable in Mysaa, her fiercest film yetRashmika Mandanna announced her new film, titled 'Mysaa'. The first poster of the film featured her as a fierce warrior. More details about the film have been kept under wraps.

Actor Brad Pitt's home ransacked in Los Angeles, police investigate burglaryActor Brad Pitt's Los Feliz house was burgled while he was busy with the global promotional tour of his new sports action-drama 'F1'. This incident highlights a growing trend of burglaries in high-profile Los Angeles neighbourhoods.

Neeru Bajwa deletes Sardaar Ji 3 Instagram posts amid row over Diljit's filmAmid backlash for her upcoming film 'Sardaar Ji 3' with Diljit Dosanjh and Hania Aamir, Neeru Bajwa has deleted all her social media posts related to the film.

Vishnu Manchu on Kannappa: My movie will not come to OTT before 10 weeksActor Vishnu Manchu shared his plans for releasing 'Kannappa' on OTT. The actor stated that his film will not be released digitally before 10 weeks.

KPop Demon Hunters review: This is Netflix's most fun animated film yetReleased-Fri Jun 20, 2025'KPop Demon Hunters' on Netflix mixes catchy K-pop with supernatural demon hunting in a unique animated series. The show balances emotional depth and high-energy action to deliver a fresh entertainment experience.

Maa review: Kajol salvages striking but familiar myth-meets-fantasy horrorReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025'Maa' movie review: 'Maa' features Kajol as a mother battling dark mythological forces in a visually rich horror setting. Despite impressive effects, the film struggles with predictable storytelling and emotional impact.

Alia Bhatt revives Rekha's stunning Silsila look in pink saree at Umrao Jaan eventAlia Bhatt channelled Rekha's iconic 'Silsila' look as she attended the screening of 'Umrao Jaan' in Mumbai. 'Umrao Jaan' is set to re-release in theatres on June 27.

Kamal Haasan, Ayushmann among 534 people invited to join Academy for Oscar votingIndian actors Kamal Haasan, Ayushmann Khurrana, filmmaker Payal Kapadia, singer-actor Ariana Grande and 531 people from across the globe have been invited to join The Academy. Upon acceptation, the members will be able to cast their vote for Oscars.
'Mission: Impossible' composer Lalo Schifrin dies at 93Lalo Schifrin, Grammy-winning composer of the iconic Mission: Impossible theme, dies at 93 after a legendary music career.

Squid Game Season 3: Front man's identity fuels deadly showdown in final chapterSquid Game Season 3, the final chapter, premieres June 27 on Netflix. With only six episodes, it continues Gi-hun's battle against the Front Man in the deadliest round of games yet.

Allison Williams marries Alexander Dreymon after years of private romanceAllison Williams and Alexander Dreymon recently married after years of keeping their relationship private. The couple shares a son and continues to guard their personal life while fans celebrate their union.

Anna Wintour steps down as US Vogue's editor-in-chief after 37 yearsAnna Wintour updated Vogue by mixing luxury fashion with street style and featuring celebrities. She also supported new designers and helped launch Vogue editions around the world.

Kareena Kapoor ate parathas during Tashan, jokes about Katrina Kaif's only salmon dietActor Kareena Kapoor Khan spoke about having parathas for breakfast during the filming of her film 'Tashan' in a conversation with actor Vicky Kaushal. She also joked about actor Katrina Kaif's 'Dhoom phase' when she was on 'only salmon' diet.

Rana Daggubati joins Ram Pothineni's next as producerRana Daggubati has teamed up with the makers of 'Baahubali' to support Ram Pothineni's forthcoming film. The announcement of the film is yet to be made.

Mika Singh says Diljit Dosanjh isn't matured enough, wants him to apologiseMika Singh exclusively spoke to India Today, expressing his disappointment in singer-actor Diljit Dosanjh, amid 'Sardaar Ji 3' row. He urged Dosanjh to apologise and take down posts promoting the upcoming film.

Karisma Kapoor thanks fans for support in first post after ex Sunjay Kapur's deathActor Karisma Kapoor, who turned 51 on June 25, thanked everyone for their birthday wishes.  This was her first post after the death of her ex-husband, Sunjay Kapur.

general news.headline: India suggests 4-pronged plan to China to manage border tensions, better tiesDefence Minister Rajnath Singh suggested a four-point formula to his Chinese counterpart, Admiral Dong Jun, during a bilateral meeting on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) in Qingdao, China.

Trump says China trade deal done, hints at 'very big' trade agreement with IndiaUS President Donald Trump announced a trade deal with China on rare earths and hinted at a major upcoming deal with India, aiming to strengthen US global trade ties and supply chain stability.

Thackeray reunion over 'Hindi imposition', Uddhav, Raj to lead joint protest in MumbaiBoth Shiv Sena (UBT) and the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena slammed Devendra Fadnavis's move, calling it an imposition of a 'language emergency' and an attempt to erase 'Marathi-ness.'

Tow trolley, 40 staffers from UK as F-35 refuses to leave Kerala even after 13 daysBraving rain on Thiruvananthapuram airport's tarmac, the British $110-million stealth F-35B jet remains grounded in Kerala, now to be towed into a hangar for repairs. A special tow vehicle and 40 UK engineers are flying in to fix the hydraulic snag that's kept the F-35B earthbound since June 14.

Maa review: Kajol salvages striking but familiar myth-meets-fantasy horrorReleased-Fri Jun 27, 2025'Maa' movie review: 'Maa' features Kajol as a mother battling dark mythological forces in a visually rich horror setting. Despite impressive effects, the film struggles with predictable storytelling and emotional impact.

Dutch man flies to Bengal to meet online friend, lands in police trouble insteadDutch national Henricks met a girl, not knowing she was a minor, through social media and their friendship grew so much so that Henrick decided to meet her and left Amsterdam for India last Sunday.

Wanted to eliminate Khamenei, but got no oppurtunity: Israel Defence MinisterIsrael's Defence Minister, Israel Katz, said they would have killed Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei during the 12-day war, if possible. Khamenei had gone underground as Israel targeted top Iranian officials during the conflict.

A slap across face and gang war: Why a Sikh man was hacked to death in UKA Sikh man was brutally hacked to death in the UK's Shrewsbury in August 2023 in a revenge ambush linked to a Sikh gang feud. According to the Daily Mail, the conflict began with a slap over a monetary dispute and escalated over several months of violent clashes, culminating in the brutal killing of the 23-year-old parcel delivery service driver.

Watch: Cop hangs on to speeding car in movie-style police chaseA sub-inspector in Tamil Nadu was injured after clinging to a fleeing car driven by a wanted career criminal during a dramatic highway chase.
Meril Launches MyClip, India's First Transcatheter-Edge-to-Edge Repair (TEER) SystemThe launch of MyClip TEER System marks a transformative moment for structural heart therapy in India.

Annamalai to get national role, but continue work in Tamil Nadu, says Amit ShahUnion Home Minister Amit Shah revealed that former Tamil Nadu BJP state chief K Annamalai will be given national responsibilities, while playing key role in Tamil Nadu politics. Shah also asserted that the NDA will form the Tamil Nadu government in 2026.

No intention to sideline India: Bangladesh denies forming alliance with China, PakBangladesh, China and Pakistan held an 'informal trilateral meeting' on the sidelines of two Beijing-sponsored regional events, the China-South Asia Exposition and the China-South Asia Cooperation Forum in Kunming.

Jeff Bezos Venice wedding: Kardashians, Leo DiCaprio, Orlando Bloom check inBillionaire Jeff Bezos and fiancee Lauren Sanchez have begun their lavish three-day wedding festivities in Venice. The Kardashian family, Oprah Winfrey, Leonardo DiCaprio, and Bill Gates, among other celebrities, got clicked as they joined the couple for the festivities.

Man's body found inside blue drum in Ludhiana, neck, legs tied with ropeA decomposed body of a man, suspected to be a migrant, was found inside a blue drum in Punjab's Ludhiana. Police are scanning CCTV footage and questioning local drum manufacturers and migrants as part of the investigation into the case.

Shubhanshu Shukla among the Stars: India on the road to GaganyaanThe Government of India and the Indian Space Research Organisation (Isro) have shown immense foresight in bringing this to reality through a strategic collaboration with NASA and the American private space-tech company Axiom Space.

Country first: How KL Rahul paused new dad duties to prepare for England tourDelhi Capitals head coach Hemang Badani revealed that KL Rahul chose duty over personal life by flying to England for the India A tour, even though he had just become a father.

Pics: Jagannath Rath Yatra begins in Puri, lakhs of devotees in attendanceThe Jagannath Rath Yatra is a major Hindu festival celebrated each year in Odisha. It is observed on Dwitiya Tithi, the second day of the waxing phase of the lunar month of Asadh, as per the Hindu calendar.

Gangster Jaggu Bhagwanpuria's mother shot dead, rival group claims responsibilityThe attack occurred near a bakery on Kadian Road in Punjab, where unidentified assailants on a motorcycle opened fire on the Scorpio car.

Actor Brad Pitt's home ransacked in Los Angeles, police investigate burglaryActor Brad Pitt's Los Feliz house was burgled while he was busy with the global promotional tour of his new sports action-drama 'F1'. This incident highlights a growing trend of burglaries in high-profile Los Angeles neighbourhoods.

Does coach Gautam Gambhir really have a problem with Rishabh Pant?Did coach Gautam Gambhir really take a dig at Rishabh Pant, or are we just reading too much into a grumpy press conference after the Leeds Test? Turns out, the internet may have spun a spicy feud out of a classic Gambhir moment.

Chinese boy runs back home for food during earthquake. Video makes Internet LOLWhile most people instinctively rushed to safety during the earthquake, this little boy's priorities made the internet laugh out loud.

Earning wife still entitled to maintenance from husband, rules Bombay High CourtAccording to the husband, the wife left the matrimonial home and started residing with her parents from 2015. He claimed that their relationship had soured due to her tantrums and ill-treatment. Despite him buying a new flat to ensure her comfort, as per her wishes, her attitude did not change, and she imposed conditions he found impossible to meet.

Jaipur man raped minor daughters for years, mother stayed silent due to stigmaCounselling sessions with the mother uncovered that she had witnessed her husband's obscene acts with their daughters multiple times but refrained from reporting due to fear of social stigma.

75-year-old man caught after 23 years for killing wife, dumping body in gunny bagAfter more than two decades of evading justice, a 75-year-old man was arrested for the murder of his wife. The police in Karnataka's Gangavati city arrested him when he returned to his native village.

sports.headline: Avinash Sable eyes personal best and World Championship redemptionAvinash Sable has recovered from a year-long injury and is preparing for the World Athletics Championships. His focus is on improving his personal best and making a strong comeback on the global stage.

WI vs AUS: Coach Sammy meets referee Srinath over contentious TV umpiring decisionsWest Indies coach Darren Sammy spoke with match referee Javagal Srinath to express his apprehensions about Adrian Holdstock officiating in the ongoing Test series against Australia. The West Indies head coach had also raised similar concerns during the series against England.

No Williamson; Milne, Henry return as New Zealand announce tri-series squadNew Zealand have named Adam Milne and uncapped Bevon Jacobs in their T20I squad for next month's tri-series in Zimbabwe, but will be without Kane Williamson and Lockie Ferguson as new head coach Rob Walter begins preparations for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

European teams vs USA weather: FIFA Club World Cup is facing the heatSoaring heat and poor pitches at the 2025 Club World Cup in the U.S. left European teams struggling, raising serious concerns for FIFA ahead of next year's expanded World Cup across North America.

Club World Cup: Man City crush Juve in 5-2 win, Real Madrid down SalzburgManchester City ended their group stage with yet another emphatic win, picking up a 5-2 victory to secure their place in the knockout stages of the FIFA World Cup. Meanwhile, Real Madrid also put up a clinical display in their 3-0 win over RB Salzburg.

Country first: How KL Rahul paused new dad duties to prepare for England tourDelhi Capitals head coach Hemang Badani revealed that KL Rahul chose duty over personal life by flying to England for the India A tour, even though he had just become a father.

Ex-India coach backs Yashasvi Jaiswal after Leeds fielding nightmareFormer India fielding coach R Sridhar has come out in support of Yashasvi Jaiswal after the young opener faced heavy criticism for his fielding lapses during the first Test between India and England at Headingley, Leeds.

ICC defines exact powerplay overs in shortened T20s after Test rules overhaulThe International Cricket Council has announced new powerplay rules for shortened T20 matches, clearly defining the number of overs allowed upfront with a restricted field in its updated Playing Conditions for the shortest format.

Australia take upper hand after contentious umpiring calls on day 2Australia carved out an 82-run lead over the West Indies on day two of the first Test in Barbados, with the hosts left frustrated by a series of close umpiring calls that went against them.

Sachin Tendulkar has asked me to come back on right track: Prithvi ShawIndia batter Prithvi Shaw has revealed that legendary batter Sachin Tendulkar has urged him to return to the right track amid the tumultuous period in his career.

Country first: How KL Rahul paused new dad duties to prepare for England tourDelhi Capitals head coach Hemang Badani revealed that KL Rahul chose duty over personal life by flying to England for the India A tour, even though he had just become a father.

Ex-India coach backs Yashasvi Jaiswal after Leeds fielding nightmareFormer India fielding coach R Sridhar has come out in support of Yashasvi Jaiswal after the young opener faced heavy criticism for his fielding lapses during the first Test between India and England at Headingley, Leeds.

ICC defines exact powerplay overs in shortened T20s after Test rules overhaulThe International Cricket Council has announced new powerplay rules for shortened T20 matches, clearly defining the number of overs allowed upfront with a restricted field in its updated Playing Conditions for the shortest format.

Australia take upper hand after contentious umpiring calls on day 2Australia carved out an 82-run lead over the West Indies on day two of the first Test in Barbados, with the hosts left frustrated by a series of close umpiring calls that went against them.

Sachin Tendulkar has asked me to come back on right track: Prithvi ShawIndia batter Prithvi Shaw has revealed that legendary batter Sachin Tendulkar has urged him to return to the right track amid the tumultuous period in his career.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
